meanings.definition: To surpass in charm or attractiveness.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outcharm everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The new puppy seemed to outcharm the older dog with its playful antics.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to outcharm the audience with his latest trick.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could outcharm the brightest of stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's laughter had the power to outcharm even the grumpiest of neighbors.

meanings.definition: To charm more than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to outcharm his rival in the singing competition.
meanings.sent2: The salesman tried to outcharm his competitors with his persuasive techniques.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outcharm the dog by purring and rubbing against its leg.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness could outcharm any negativity that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The actor's performance was so captivating that it could outcharm the audience into a standing ovation.
